text: obviously still very active as a trader so first off i would love to just get a you know quick synopsis of how you got started in the markets and what did that look like for you yeah i was a chemical engineer out of clarkson university up in northern new york this is back in 1974 at the end of a 50 down market on the s p so i'm making 12 000 a year and in those days 12 000 a year was a lot of money and uh so i started sucking money into a stock account at lunch a bunch of us engineers would sit around at lunch and talk about investments and what newsletters we were reading and what their our brokers told us and sharing ideas and eventually led to an investment club of some sort and another guy and myself started practically managing it de facto because nobody else in the club really could had any energy to do anything so little by little we took over that and it kind of raised a bunch of money and uh we hooked up with the third guy and uh that ended up forming a firm investment advisory firm which we ran part-time for about three years or so while we were still working as during the day as chemical engineers and one thing led to another pretty soon we have enough money under management we can afford my salary outside of the chemical company
